intro: Xerotes glauca, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its finely divided, silvery-blue leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, fluffy white flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. Xerotes glauca thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soils. It is drought-tolerant and often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
